com.ashtonit.odb

Class OdbFilter

  • Object
    • com.ashtonit.odb.OdbFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Filter

    public class OdbFilter
extends Object
implements Filter

    This class is responsible for obtaining an OrientGraph instance from OrientGraphPool and setting it as an attribute on the request object.

    It pulls two context parameters from the servlet context;

    orientGraph is used to set the name of the request attribute that will contain the instance of OrientGraph as its value.

    orientGraphPool tells this OdbFilter instance the JNDI name of the graph database pool instance relative to, "java:comp/env". It must match your resource configuration.

    Both of these values can be configured in the web.xml file with a context-param element, as below; 

     <context-param>
     <param-name>orientGraph</param-name>
     <param-value>graph</param-value>
 </context-param>
 
 <context-param>
     <param-name>orientGraphPool</param-name>
     <param-value>odbp</param-value>
 </context-param>
    Author:
    Bruce Ashton

      • destroy

      • doFilter

        public void doFilter(ServletRequest request,
                     ServletResponse response,
                     FilterChain chain)
              throws IOException,
                     ServletException

        Get the database parameters from the user principal, create an OrientGraph object and set it as an attribute on the request. Clean up the OrientGraph object once the Servlet service method has completed. Set the principal as an attribute on the session so we can clean up database connections later.

        It uses the orientGraph and orientGraphPool context parameters.

        Specified by:
        doFilter in interface Filter
        Parameters:
        request - the HTTP Servlet request object
        response - the HTTP Servlet response object
        chain - the chain object for the chain of command pattern.
        Throws:
        IOException - might be thrown by chain.doFilter()
        ServletException - might be thrown by chain.doFilter()
        See Also:
        Filter.doFilter(ServletRequest, ServletResponse, FilterChain)

      • init

        public void init(FilterConfig config)

        This method pulls two context parameters from the servlet context;

        orientGraph is used to set the name of the session attribute that will contain the instance of OrientGraph as its value.

        orientGraphPool sets the JNDI name of the graph database pool instance relative to, "java:comp/env".

        Both of these values can be configured in the web.xml file with a context-param element, as below; 

         <context-param>
     <param-name>orientGraph</param-name>
     <param-value>graph</param-value>
 </context-param>
 
 <context-param>
     <param-name>orientGraphPool</param-name>
     <param-value>odbp</param-value>
 </context-param>
        Specified by:
        init in interface Filter
        Parameters:
        config - the container object for filter parameters
        See Also:
        Filter.init(FilterConfig)
